intro: Venidium puberulum, commonly known as the hairy venidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. It is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Venidium puberulum is often found in woodland edges and along streambanks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
